common.too_large_input: Too large input file (should currently be under 8Mb)

common.alert_upload_shp: All mandatory files (.shp, .dbf, .shx, .prj) have to be provided for shapefile upload
common.layer_success: Layer successfully added to the map
common.ask_replace_dataset: An additional dataset has already been provided. Replace by this one ?
common.error_message: Something wrong happened - Current operation has been aborted.
common.error_discretization: Something went wrong with choosen discretization (try with a {{arg}} number of class and/or another method)
common.error_only_layout: Only layout layers can be added here
common.error_only_one: Only one layer can be added by this functionnality
common.error_existing_scalebar: Only one scale bar can be added - Use right click to change its properties
common.error_max_arrows: Maximum number of arrows reached - Only 30 arrows can be created in this functionnality
common.error_numerical_fields: The targeted layer doesn't seems to contain any numerical field or contains too many empty values
common.error_too_many_features: Very many features. Navigation ease might be degraded.
common.error_values_order: Values have to be ordered (from the minimum to the maximum)
common.warning_multiple_layers: Layers from TopoJSON have to be provided one by one. Only the first one will be added.

func_description.smooth: Render a smoothed map (using stewart potentials algorythm)
func_description.prop: Display proportional symbols on a numerical field of your data
func_description.choroprop: Display proportional symbols and choropleth coloration of the symbols on two numerical fields of your dataset with an appropriate discretisation
func_description.proptypo: Display proportional symbols colored according to their belonging to a categorie
func_description.choro: Render a choropleth map on a numerical field of your data with an appropriate discretisation
func_description.cartogram: Render a map using an area-deforming algorythm on a numerical field of your data
func_description.grid: Render a gridded density map on a numerical field of your data
func_description.flow: Render a map displaying links between features with graduated sizes
func_description.discont: Render a map displaying discontinuities between polygons features
func_description.typo: Render a categorical map with an attribute field of your dataset
func_description.label: Display and customize feature labels
func_description.typosymbol: Display pictograms on the features of the map

lm_buttons.hand_button: Use the cursor to move on the map (default behavior)

choro.title: Choropleth map
choro.block:
Ratio data (rates or intensity) are quantitative data calculated from raw data from which relationships are derived or rates calculated. They represent the characteristics of observed variables but their sum does not have a particular meaning, e.g. population density is a relationship value but the sum of population densities is not a meaningful indicator.

Parameters
Field : Field name for values to use.

typo.title: Categorical map
typo.block:
This kind of map is user to represent polygon features according to the value taken by a field whose values are grouped into categories.

Parameters
Field : Field name for values to use.

typosymbol.title: Categorical symbols map
typosymbol.block:
This type of representation enables to include symbols on the basis of values of a categorical field of the data layer.

Parameters
Field : Field name for values to use.

smooth.title: Smoothed map
smooth.block:
Unlike choropleth maps, which represent the data set as discrete values only valid for specific areas, isoline maps are based on the assumption that the phenomenon to be represented has a continuous distribution. Many socio-economic phenomena are distributed spatially according to continuous logic, with no breaks at the borders, which appear as artificial cuts. If the observed phenomenon is a continuous underlying distribution, i.e. it takes values that are gradually different as one moves into the space around a given point, the purpose of the "smoothed" map is to visualize the phenomenon respecting its spatial organization. This method is called this "potential calculating method" or "smoothing method". It allows the spatial representation of the phenomenon, regardless of the heterogeneity of the mesh and affecting at any point of the map, the value of the density of the phenomenon in the vicinity of this point.

Parameters
Field: Field name of value to use.
Divide field (optionnal): Field name for value to use in order to make a ratio.
Span:
Beta:
Resolution :
Function type :
Number of classes :
Clipping mask layer :

Plus d'informations...

prop.title: Raw data map / Proportionnal symbols
prop.block:
Absolute value (stock) data maps enable representation of quantitative data which can be raw data or expressed in absolute terms. A data is quantitative if it can be expressed in units that can be aggregated and their averages are meaningful. This data express concrete quantity, i.e, the sum of individual elements is meaningful; e.g. population size is an absolute value because the sum of a number of different population sizes is meaningful.

Parameters
Valeur : Le champ contenant les valeurs à utiliser.
Taille fixée : Taille (px) à appliquer sur le valeur définie à la suite.
Type de symbole : Le type de symbole à utiliser (cercle ou carré)
Couleur du symbole : La ou les couleurs des symboles, selon qu'un seuil soit défini.

discont.title: Discontinuities map
discont.block:
When combined with a choropleth representation (see ratio maps), the visualization of discontinuity lines focus on spatial ruptures of the socio-economic phenomena being observed. This is in line with Brunet and Dolphus (1990) expression "geographical space is fundamentally discontinuous". In this atlas, discontinuities are expressed in relative terms: Maxima (ratio1, ratio2) / Minima (ratio1, ratio2). To express the scope of the discontinuity intensity, we choose to represent it by the "size" of a line, the change of thickness of it being proportional to the intensity of the discontinuity. This kind of representation focus, not on the homogenous zones, but rather on border lines indicating wide variations in the phenomenon represented on the map.

Parameters
Field : Field name for values to use.
ID field : Le champ contenant des identifiants uniques permettant d'identifier des tronçons
Discontinuity kind : Le rapport entre la valeur des deux entités (parmis 'relatif' ou 'absolu').
Number of classes : How many classes to be created.
Discretization type : La méthode utilisée pour discrétiser les valeurs.
Couleur : Method used to arrange the serie of values into dicrete classes.

grid.title: Grid map
grid.block:
The cartographic representation mostly relies on an administrative meshing which is a spatial filter of the geographical information. This filter deforms all the more the message conveyed by the map as the meshing is heterogeneous.

Parameters
Field : Field name for values to use.
Cellsize : Side size of each cell (kilometers).
Shape :The shape to be taken be the created cells.
Coloramp : Coloramp to be used when the result is added.

cartogram.title: Cartogram
cartogram.block:
In a common way, an anamorphosis is a distorted projection or perspective requiring the viewer to use special devices or occupy a specific vantage point to reconstitute the image. The word is derived from the Greek prefix ana-, meaning back or again, and the word morphe, meaning shape or form. According to Webster dictionary "An anamorphosis is a deformed image that appears in its true shape when viewed in some "unconventional" way". In cartography we call them "cartograms" or "anamorphic map". A cartogram is a map in which some thematic mapping variable – such as population or Gross National Product- is substituted for land area or distance. The geometry or space of the map is distorted in order to convey the information of this alternate variable. We also can describe a cartogram as a type of graphic that depicts attributes of geographic objects as the object's area. Because a cartogram does not depict geographic space, but rather changes the size of objects depending on a certain attribute, a cartogram is not a true map.

Parameters
Field :Field name for values to use
Symbol type : The shape of the symbol to use.
Taille fixée : Taille (px) à appliquer sur le valeur définie à la suite.
On value... : Value on which fix the previously selected size.
Iterations : How many iterations before getting the result.
Dimensionner la taille de référence : La valeur statistique à utiliser comme référence pour la transformation.

choroprop.title: Raw and ratio data map - Proportionnal colored symbols
choroprop.block:
This kind of representation enables to establish a match between raw and relationship data on a single map. Thus, the user will view a given phenomenon expressed in both raw and relationship data on the same map.

Parameters
Field 1 (symbol size): Field containing values to use to compute symbols size.
Fixed size : Taille (px) à appliquer à la valeur définie à la suite.
Sur la valeur... : Valeur sur laquelle fixer la taille.
Type de symbole : Le type de symbole à utiliser (cercle ou carré).
Valeur 2 (couleur du symbole) : Champ contenant les valeurs à utiliser (après discrétisation) pour colorer les symboles.

proptypo.title: Raw and categorical data map - Proportionnal colored symbols
proptypo.block: This kind of representation enables to establish a match between raw and categorical data on a single map.

flow.title: Links map
flow.block:
This kind of representation enables to draw proportionnal lines (streams/links) according to the intensity of a phenomenon between pairs of places.

Parameters
Champ i : Le champ contenant les identifiants des entités 'origine'.
Champ j : Le champ contenant les identifiants des entités 'destination'.
Champ fij : Le champ contenant les valeurs de l'intensité du phénomène entre 'i' et 'j'.
Type de discrétisation : Le type de méthode à utiliser pour discrétiser les valeurs.
Nombre de classes : Le nombre de classes à créer lors de l'application de la méthode précédemment définie.

label.title: Label map
label.block:
Ce type de carte permet de représenter les intitulés correspondants aux entités d'une couche.

Parameters

intro_section.arg2: Use your own data (Shapefile, GeoJSON, kml, fichier de données tabulaire, etc.)
intro_section.arg4: Export or save your composition with ease! (SVG and PNG exports, project saving in human-readable fashion)

overview_section.list_func1: Conventional cartographic methods coupled with innovative techniques
overview_section.list_func2: (proportionnal symbols, choropleth map, discontinuity map, smoothed map, gridded map, cartogram, etc.)
overview_section.import1: Allow to use a wide range of file format
overview_section.import2: (Shapefile, GeoJSON, kml, tabular file with coordinates or tabular data to be joinded with the geographic layer, etc.)
overview_section.customize1: Customize your map as you wish
overview_section.customize2: (thanks to a large choice of projection, coloramps, fonts, and more...!)
overview_section.export_geo1: Download your newly created geographic layers
overview_section.export_geo2: (file formats and projection available for export are too numerous to be listed)
overview_section.conclusion: You might not need your favorite vector editing software !

examples_section.gallery: More examples are visible on the gallery

documentation_section.intro: A full description of each of the methods is available on the website http://onapastrouvedenom.fr. The website also includes detailed information on the technologies employed and is used to announce the latest changes.

source_section.box1_text:
The project is fully free and open-sourced (licenced under CeCILL, compatible with GNU GPL).
It's backed against a solid and modern suite of Free and Open-Source libraries (like GDAL and Python asyncio on server-side and d3.js v4 on front-end).
source_section.box2_text: Bug reports and contributions are welcome. Please use project page on GitHub.
source_section.box3_text: Code is instrumented for localization and 2 languages are currently availables.
source_section.box4_text: Project is still under developpement. More features to come, hang tight!

cookie_div.message: We do NOT use cookies to profile or track users.
